intro: Fagara flava, commonly known as the yellow fagara, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, round berries containing seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
